Bash(git -C /Users/agi_dev/LOCAL-REPOS/Lukhas commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
feat(infrastructure): implement T4/0.01% system fusion layer with meta-registry and ledger analytics

Problem:
- MODULE_REGISTRY.json lacks integrated metrics (coverage, benchmarks, health scores)
- No validation that manifest changes have corresponding ledger entries
- Missing trend analytics for coverage and benchmark progression
- No comprehensive pre-sprint validation checkpoint

Solution:
- Created generate_meta_registry.py (150 lines)
  - Fuses MODULE_REGISTRY + coverage ledger + benchmark ledger
  - Calculates health scores (0-100): coverage (50 pts) + SLA (30 pts) + docs (20 pts)
  - Generates META_REGISTRY.json with unified analytics source
  
- Created ci/ledger_consistency.py (150 lines)
  - Validates manifest changes have ledger entries within ¬±1 minute
  - Prevents silent, non-provenance edits to manifests
  - CI workflow enforces on all PRs touching manifests
  
- Created analytics/coverage_trend.py (100 lines)
  - Reads coverage.ndjson and generates daily delta trends
  - CSV output: date, module, coverage_pct, delta_from_previous
  - Supports both "timestamp"/"ts" and "coverage_pct"/"coverage" field names
  
- Created analytics/bench_trend.py (105 lines)
  - Reads bench.ndjson and generates performance delta trends
  - CSV output includes p50/p95/p99 latencies and environment fingerprint
  - Tracks performance regression across builds
  
- Created validate_t4_checkpoint.py (200 lines)
  - Comprehensive validation: registry + meta-registry + ledgers + trends
  - 8 validation checks with pass/fail reporting
  - Strict mode for fail-fast CI integration
  
- Updated Makefile with 6 new targets
  - make meta-registry: Generate fused analytics
  - make ledger-check: Validate ledger consistency
  - make trends: Generate CSV trend analytics
  - make validate-t4: Run full validation checkpoint
  - make validate-t4-strict: Fail-fast validation mode
  - make tag-prod: Tag v0.01-prod after validation passes

Impact:
- Single META_REGISTRY.json source for dashboards, Notion, Observatory
- Ledger consistency enforced via CI gate
- Complete audit trail for all metrics with trend tracking
- Pre-sprint validation ensures system health
- 149 modules with avg health score 20.2/100 (baseline established)

Technical Details:
- Health score algorithm: min(50, coverage/2) + (30 if meets_sla) + (20 if has_docs)
- Ledger consistency uses git commit timestamps (¬±1 minute tolerance)
- Trend analytics support multiple field name conventions
- All scripts are idempotent and dry-run capable

- scripts/generate_meta_registry.py (150 lines)
- scripts/ci/ledger_consistency.py (150 lines)
- scripts/analytics/coverage_trend.py (100 lines)
- scripts/analytics/bench_trend.py (105 lines)
- scripts/validate_t4_checkpoint.py (200 lines)
- docs/_generated/META_REGISTRY.json (unified analytics)
- .github/workflows/ledger-consistency.yml (CI enforcement)

- Academic/institutional users need citable DOI for LUKHAS AI releases

- Version tracking and discoverability needed for research citations
- No formal publication workflow for making releases citable

- Created zenodo.metadata.json (complete release metadata)

  - Complete creator/contributor information
  - Keywords: LUKHAS, symbolic AI, infrastructure, provenance, reproducibility
  - Related identifiers linking to GitHub releases
  - Subject terms: AI, Software Engineering, Reproducible Research
  - Method documentation: deterministic scripts, ledgers, CI validation
  
- Created scripts/release/zenodo_upload.sh (automated deposition)
  - Interactive sandbox/production workflow
